Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the alleged surge in COVID cases due to Wisconsinites voting.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or sources to support the assertion that the mainstream media pretended there was a deadly surge in COVID cases.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the mainstream media intentionally misrepresented the situation regarding COVID cases and the election in Wisconsin.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the reported cases of COVID-19 related to the election, such as other possible exposures outside of voting.
Understate: The claim understates the number of cases related to the election, as it accounted for less than 4% of the total positive tests in the given time period.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there were cases of COVID-19 related to the election, although the extent and origin of those cases remain uncertain.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing consistent and reliable evidence or sources to support its argument.
